distributional 0.2.2.9000
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Sampling distribution

Source: R/dist_sample.R
dist_sample.Rd

dist_sample(x)

Arguments

x

A list of sampled values.

Examples

# Univariate numeric samples
dist <- dist_sample(x = list(rnorm(100), rnorm(100, 10)))

dist
#> <distribution[2]>
#> [1] sample[100] sample[100]
mean(dist)
#> [1]  0.1748178 10.1101686
variance(dist)
#> [1] 1.0459717 0.7617778
skewness(dist)
#> [1] -0.07661729 -0.07028153
generate(dist, 10)
#> [[1]]
#>  [1]  1.7377367  1.2757040  0.3994854 -0.4942129 -0.1095725 -2.1788749
#>  [7]  0.2013537  0.4788557 -0.1647946 -0.3961937
#> 
#> [[2]]
#>  [1]  9.268545 10.489556 10.879652 11.784190 10.392059 10.281887  9.969334
#>  [8] 11.219636  9.434365 10.888471
#> 

density(dist, 1)
#> [1] 0.2528344 0.0000000

# Multivariate numeric samples
dist <- dist_sample(x = list(cbind(rnorm(100), rnorm(100, 10))))

dist
#> <distribution[1]>
#> [1] sample[100]
mean(dist)
#> [1]  0.05533372 10.04846044
variance(dist)
#>             [,1]        [,2]
#> [1,]  0.97611783 -0.04169912
#> [2,] -0.04169912  0.95150160
skewness(dist)
#> [1] -0.0006113191
generate(dist, 10)
#> [[1]]
#>             [,1]      [,2]
#>  [1,] -1.6958899 13.339251
#>  [2,] -0.2593059  9.994430
#>  [3,] -1.6958899 13.339251
#>  [4,]  1.8052011  9.205890
#>  [5,]  0.9569738 10.267801
#>  [6,]  0.1037576  9.449444
#>  [7,]  0.2332296 11.188480
#>  [8,]  0.4095851  8.301431
#>  [9,]  0.3491112 11.551473
#> [10,]  2.1150012  9.572954
#> 

density(dist, 1)
#> [1] 0.244692 0.000000
